abstract: Human rights activists report that former trickle of would-be visitors attempting to visit Chinese dissident Chen Guangcheng, under house arrest in eastern Shandong Province, has become a campaign, with dozens of admirers from across China embarking on journey.
snippet: Admirers of Chen Guangcheng, a lawyer who exposed forced sterilizations and abortions, have been beaten and rebuffed while trying to visit his village — but their numbers are growing.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

lead_paragraph: Admirers of Chen Guangcheng, a lawyer who exposed forced sterilizations and abortions, have been beaten and rebuffed while trying to visit his village — but their numbers are growing.

headline.main: Taking Big Risks to See a Chinese Dissident Under House Arrest
headline.print_headline: Taking Big Risks to See a Chinese Dissident Under House Arrest
headline.seo: Despite Violence, Chinese Dissident’s Emboldened Supporters Stream to See Him
